CatDescriptText: Mrs. Delores Smith, housewife, 818 Clarissa Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 29, 1958 with question: "Do you think that taverns should be permitted to remain open past midnight on Saturdays?" answer reads: "No, I don't think that it's right. I think that they should recognize Sunday as a holy day.  It's all right for the taverns to be open six days a week, but on Sunday-- well that day should be kept sacred."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Delores Smith, wearing dark button down textured coat with collar and lapels and light colored shirt, carrying handbag, standing in front of Pontiac, with buildings in background
